definition: The fact or condition of being addicted to a particular substance, thing, or activity.
mnemonic: Addiction sounds like 'addition,' indicating an added or uncontrollable craving.
visual_representation: Picture someone repeatedly reaching for a substance, unable to resist, symbolizing addiction.
example_sentence: His addiction to video games began to affect his schoolwork and social life.

definition: Affected by or associated with nausea or vomiting; spiteful or bad-tempered.
mnemonic: Bilious sounds like 'bile,' the bitter fluid associated with illness and bad temper.
visual_representation: Picture someone with a greenish tint, looking nauseous and irritable, symbolizing being bilious.
example_sentence: The bilious man grumbled at everything, making those around him uncomfortable.

definition: Moving or tending to move away from a center.
hindi_meaning: केन्द्रीयविकर्षक, केंद्र से दूर जाने वाला
mnemonic: Centrifugal sounds like 'center-flee,' indicating movement away from the center.
visual_representation: Picture a spinning wheel where objects are thrown outward, away from the center, symbolizing centrifugal force.
example_sentence: The centrifugal force caused the water to fly out of the spinning bucket.

definition: Possessed or influenced by a demon; extremely evil or frenzied; a person believed to be possessed by a demon.
mnemonic: Demoniac sounds like 'demon-like,' indicating something or someone extremely evil or frenzied.
visual_representation: Picture someone with wild eyes and a frenzied expression, symbolizing a demoniac appearance.
example_sentence: The demoniac laughter of the villain sent chills down the spines of the characters in the movie.

definition: To absorb all the attention or interest of someone.
hindi_meaning: पूरी तरह ध्यान लगाना, मग्न होना
mnemonic: Engross sounds like 'en-gross,' as in being grossly involved or fully absorbed.
visual_representation: Picture someone reading a book so intently that they are unaware of their surroundings, symbolizing engrossment.
example_sentence: The novel was so captivating that it engrossed me for hours.

definition: To move swiftly and lightly.
mnemonic: Flit sounds like 'fleet,' indicating a quick and light movement.
visual_representation: Imagine a butterfly flitting from flower to flower, symbolizing light, swift movement.
example_sentence: The bird flitted from branch to branch, barely pausing for a moment.

definition: To struggle or wrestle with something, especially in a physical fight or with a problem; an act of grappling.
mnemonic: Grapple sounds like 'grip and pull,' indicating a struggle or fight.
visual_representation: Picture two wrestlers grappling with each other, struggling for control.
example_sentence: She had to grapple with her fears before stepping on stage.

definition: A person who interrupts a performer or public speaker with derisive or aggressive comments or abuse.
hindi_meaning: सवालों से परेशान करने वाला, तंग करने वाला
mnemonic: Heckler sounds like 'heckle her,' as in someone shouting or interrupting rudely.
visual_representation: Picture someone in an audience shouting insults at a speaker, symbolizing a heckler.
example_sentence: The comedian skillfully handled the heckler who kept interrupting his performance.

definition: Unable to be taken away from or given away by the possessor.
mnemonic: Inalienable sounds like 'in-alien-able,' meaning something that cannot be alienated or separated.
visual_representation: Picture a person holding tightly to a document labeled 'Rights,' symbolizing inalienable rights.
example_sentence: Freedom of speech is an inalienable right in many democracies.

definition: So foolish, unreasonable, or out of place as to be amusing; ridiculous.
mnemonic: Ludicrous sounds like 'laugh at us,' indicating something so ridiculous that it’s laughable.
visual_representation: Picture someone wearing a clown suit at a formal event, symbolizing something ludicrous.
example_sentence: The idea that the Earth is flat is ludicrous in light of all the scientific evidence.

definition: A change of the form or nature of a thing or person into a completely different one, by natural or supernatural means.
mnemonic: Metamorphosis sounds like 'meta-more-faces,' indicating a complete transformation.
visual_representation: Imagine a caterpillar transforming into a butterfly, symbolizing metamorphosis.
example_sentence: The metamorphosis of the company from a small startup to a tech giant was remarkable.

definition: A sentimental longing or wistful affection for the past, typically for a period or place with happy personal associations.
mnemonic: Nostalgia sounds like 'nostril-ia,' as in something that brings back old memories with a familiar scent.
visual_representation: Picture someone looking at old photos and smiling, lost in memories, symbolizing nostalgia.
example_sentence: The smell of freshly baked bread filled her with nostalgia for her childhood.

definition: The outer parts of a town or city.
mnemonic: Outskirts sounds like 'out skirts,' indicating the areas on the edge or outside of the main area.
visual_representation: Picture the outer edges of a city, with less dense buildings and more open space, symbolizing the outskirts.
example_sentence: They moved to the outskirts of the city to escape the hustle and bustle of downtown.

definition: Engaged in, involving, or reflecting deep or serious thought.
mnemonic: Pensive sounds like 'penned-sive,' as if someone is writing down deep thoughts.
visual_representation: Picture someone sitting quietly by a window, lost in thought, symbolizing a pensive mood.
example_sentence: He was in a pensive mood, reflecting on the events of the past year.

definition: A reply, especially a sharp or witty one.
mnemonic: Rejoinder sounds like 're-join-her,' as in coming back with a quick response.
visual_representation: Imagine someone giving a quick, clever response in a conversation, symbolizing a rejoinder.
example_sentence: Her sharp rejoinder left everyone in the room speechless.

definition: To isolate or hide away someone or something; to take legal possession of assets until a debt has been paid or other claims have been met.
mnemonic: Sequester sounds like 'secure rest,' as in isolating someone or something to keep it secure.
visual_representation: Picture someone being placed in a quiet, isolated room, symbolizing sequestering.
example_sentence: The jury was sequestered in a hotel during the trial to prevent them from being influenced by the media.

definition: A standard or criterion by which something is judged or recognized.
mnemonic: Touchstone sounds like 'touch stone,' as if testing something by touch to check its quality.
visual_representation: Imagine a goldsmith testing the purity of gold by rubbing it against a touchstone, symbolizing a standard of judgment.
example_sentence: Her performance in the championship became the touchstone for future athletes.

definition: To find fault with someone; to scold or criticize severely.
mnemonic: Upbraid sounds like 'upbraid her,' as in scolding or criticizing someone.
visual_representation: Picture a parent sternly scolding a child for misbehavior, symbolizing upbraiding.
example_sentence: The teacher upbraided the student for not turning in the assignment on time.

definition: Speaking or spoken incessantly and fluently.
mnemonic: Voluble sounds like 'volume-able,' as in someone who speaks with a lot of words or volume.
visual_representation: Imagine someone talking rapidly and at length, hardly pausing for breath, symbolizing volubility.
example_sentence: The voluble salesman convinced many customers to buy the product.

definition: (Of a person's complexion or appearance) pale and giving the impression of illness or exhaustion.
mnemonic: Wan sounds like 'waning,' indicating a fading or weak appearance.
visual_representation: Picture someone with a pale, tired face, looking unwell, symbolizing a wan appearance.
example_sentence: She appeared wan and tired after several sleepless nights.
